comments.commentBody: Given the MO of these things, if this preservation is getting so much publicity, what was destroyed in the last days and is being covered up?  They don't expose something unless they are hiding something else.
NYT, WaPo, keep the screws on. McCain, your country is calling again.

Attorney General Sessions was asked at his hearings about contacts with the Russians. Now "roll the tape."  What do we see?  We see Sessions fumphering and giving an answer to the effect that he never met to discuss issues about the campaign.  So what?  He wasn't truthful about his contacts.  And please recall that another Attorney General had to recuse herself from any investigation into HC because she met ex-President Clinton at the airport.  Hello?  Even if you love Trump, don't you love your country more?

Whether we call the exposure of this type of information "whistle-blowing" or "leaks" seems to be the main focus of both the Trump Team and its enemies.  But separate issues that might also concern us include whether it makes sense for the "Intelligence Community" to comprise at least sixteen separate bureaucracies, plus sub-entities in God-knows where else in the national government.  It seems to me that this is a place where some zero-based congressional paring might might be wise.  Secondly, we're being told that the "leaks" included "top-secret" information ---- how much of that information was classified merely to protect it from public exposure, rather than the legal definition of "top secret," which is, "Information, the disclosure of which would seriously damage the security of the nation?"

The Attorney General has to be absolutely transparent by virtue of his position. Regardless of weather Sessions discussed the campaign or not with the Russian Ambassador he knew exactly what he was doing by not answering truthfully about his contact with Russians. Furthermore to claim it would be normal as a member of the Armed Services Foreign Affairs Committee when twenty of the twenty six other members said they never had contact with Russians indicates he mislead the Senate.
The Republican platform is burning.

Down and circling around the drain faster and faster the Democrats go .... how much longer are they going to recycle this bogus discredited story.

Seriously! Does anyone believe this tripe !?

Obama administration saves the world. Prescient in taking insurance measures in case Hillary lost.  Everyone thought that Hillary would win and all the Trump Funk would be irrelevant.  Well, hallelujah, our genious previous POTUS took nothing for granted.  God Bless you, Barak Obama!

Interesting. Not really enough to sink your teeth into yet but interesting. Unfortunately, the public is strong lensing the situation. The truth we seek to observe is bent around massive obstacles. Security clearance is an obvious and legitimate one. The power behind the accused is clearly another. The media has a better vantage point but not that much better.

The accusations of Democratic partisanship are appropriate but the same argument could be leveled at Republicans. The attorney general appears to have lied under oath and is now embroiled in a larger Russian controversy along with so many others. You don't need a witch hunt but you can't simply demure either. The position is untenable to say the least.

I have a mental picture of Paul Ryan clasping his hands and humming to himself while politely avoiding eye contact with anything but the ceiling. Awkward. John McCain would be the obvious choice for contention but his spine appears to be withering. A $54 billion dollar military bribe was all it took to silence his opposition. Again, awkward.

Maybe there's no there, there. Maybe this is just another Benghazi. If that's true though, why obstruct the investigation? Republican hypocrisy is so powerful it bends visible light. That's why we're strong lensing here. I agree Democrats shouldn't be at the reigns but neither should Jeff Sessions. Independent investigation time. Let her rip.
Trump is the first president elected by and for the people of Russia. He needs to step down.

replies.commentBody:
If you want to know who gave money to the Clinton Foundation, do a search on Wikipedia. You will find a long list of donors and what they gave. The money most likely was given hoping to curry favor but there was no quid pro quo that anyone can find just possible face time. Heck, for a mere $200,000 you can become a member of mar a lago and golf with the president. Money has always bought opportunity. You decide where opportunity ends and corruption begins like a clear pay me and I will give you a government contract or job.

If only Trump would be so transparent by posting his taxes or even members of his club.

Podesta's emails were boring. No treasonous activities with the Russians in them. However, the American people kept and keep confusing the hacks with Clinton's State Dept emails and saying see she is not trustworthy because she used a private server and it was hacked. It did affect the election turnout and enthusiasm. That is what propaganda does, makes truth hard to discern.

Netanyahu doesn't do Israel any favors and he did his country a disservice by being rude and un-statesmanlike to Obama. Netanyahu is not well loved in his own country, barely hanging on to his coalition government. Not sure why the sanctions against Russia were petty or vindictive. Seems like a measured, reasonable US response to Russian power-plays that support their efforts to re-establish the Russian Empire.

What does Trump offer that you defend him with so much hearsay.

comments.commentBody: Where's the NYT's coverage about all the foreign money that flowed into the Clinton Foundation? That money was not given out of shear charity but was given to curry favor with the expected new president. Russia is a red herring designed to detract from Hillary's loss and to cripple the Trump presidency, which it has failed to do. The Russian hacks, if they came from Russia, did not expose anything the public did not already know. The DNC colluded with Clinton. Everyone knew that. Podesta's emails were prosaic and hardly picked up by the NYT. That the Obama Administration tried to hobble Trump is also well known. They poisoned Israel's good name on the way out the door and issued petty, vindictive sanctions against Russia to thwart better relations. The current leaks by former Obama supporters are a continuation of the same.

replies.commentBody:
All things being equal (and they certainly are not), I prefer "priggish" to "piggish", which is what we have now.

And if this is "all smoke", it's certainly thick enough you can barely see his orange glow.

comments.commentBody: Coming from the Obama Administration, one of the most priggish in history, these charges smack of innuendo and recklessness. If the investigation turns out to be all smoke and no fire, I expect retribution, in the form of embarrassing info about Obama's foreign policy. I'm sure there's plenty of details about our failures in Libya and Syria that we'd all love to know. The Russians couldn't have any direct effect on the election, that's just common sense.
Quis custodiet ipsos custodes?

replies.commentBody: Clair McCaskill has already LIED!   Is that the kind of "quality" Democrat senators you refer to?   When one is biased, one never sees the warts on their side.

comments.commentBody:
It is clear that the House "investigation" can never be trusted, the Republicans having already found no "there there" before the investigation has really begun.

I have more faith, perhaps naively, in the Senate version, simply because of the quality of the Democratic Senators on it, who I believe will pressure the Committee to do a full and fair investigation, or will let us know if it is not. One critical measure will be whether or not they demand to see Trump's tax returns. If they do not, it will be another useless effort and waste of the taxpayers money.

This whole situation is such a potentially big deal that I do not understand why there is not one blue ribbon, highest security clearance, impeccably staffed and fully resourced Special Investigation team appointed to do this once and do this right, so when a conclusion is reached - whatever it is - we can all be confident in it, do whatever is suggested by the results, and put this to bed.
I read and re read this article.  Not one iota of proof is in it.  What has happened to journalism?

Thank you New York Times for continually holding this administration accountable.  Reading The Times each morning helps to remind me that the truth is out there and your journalists are on the scent trail! Keep at it!

The planned timing of all of this is as suspicious as the actually acts alleged.  I have always been a proponent of getting this thing investigated and put to bed, but to let the American people live through this spoon feeding is irresponsible.  There is obviously something to report here, but the spoon feeding of this to the public is deliberate.  Get it out and over with.  Especially since this goes back to the Obama Admin.  This is pure toying with the American people to insight a greater divide between both parties and the American voter with an eye to 2018 and 2020.  I suppose an all out impeachment is insurance for the Democratic party.  This Russian story could have prevented Trump from taking the office in the first place, saving us all from this pain.

--------------------------------------

James Comey!

That's who needs to be investigated. Why did he illegally interfere in the election?

Why did he deliberately intrude 9 days before the election?

He wouldn't say anything about the Trump-Russia connections because it was his and the FBI's policy to "not comment on ongoing investigations" and "neither confirm or deny the existence of one"-- yet, he threw that principle out the window in a blatant effort that sabotaged Hillary Clinton and kept her from being elected president.

What is the Russian-Comey connection?

Bribes? Payoff? Scandal? Threats? Blackmail?

That relationship needs investigating, big time!

------------------------------------

"The left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing"
"Meaning"
"One's varied interests are kept separate."
"Origin"
"This originates from the Bible, Matthew 6:3 (King James Version):"
"But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth."
"That meaning alluded to the wisdom of not giving oneself credit for providing charity to others - just give and forget about it. That view was reiterated by Henry Thoreau in his Walden; or life in the woods, 1854:"
""If you should ever be betrayed into any of these philanthropies, do not let your left hand know what your right hand does, for it is not worth knowing."
The original meaning of the phrase is now lost. We presently use the phrase to suggest that, in business, one should keep one's interests independent of each other."
Source: http://www.phrases.org.uk/meanings/225650.html
In this case all the above is true.

The elephant in the room (pardon pun) appears to be the possible collusion with the intent on framing and affecting the election. While it might seem probable that one would reach out to familiar sources foreign or otherwise during a campaign, it is certainly incumbent on those having such discussions to be honest when confronted.
Surrogate is an interesting term meaning I suppose "To act as representative or go between to the real power. That real power is Trump? Bannon? or yet to be named?

As a US Senator, Attorney General Nominee and Attorney, Jeff Sessions should have respected and understood the importance of being truthful under oath. If he has so little respect for truthfulness and US law, how can he be relied upon to lead the US Department of Justice? How can he be expected to lead an investigation of Trump Campaign ties and communication with Russians prior to the election, if he himself did the same thing and denied it under oath? Integrity of the US Justice system is critical to all of us. How can Jeff Sessions be trusted in his critical role as Attorney General of the United States?

Trump denies everything about his connections to Russia to the point of claiming that he has nothing to do with Russia whatsoever. How can that be? Trump is first and foremost all about making money for himself and has openly bragged about meeting all of the Russian "oligarchs" as part of his Miss Universe pageant trip in November 2013 while enjoying a two hour dinner at Moscow's Nobu located 15 minutes from the Kremlin...probably a great place for "private" conversations.

Paul Manafort, a known consort of pro-Russian political figures, becomes Trump's campaign manager and then quickly resigns once his connections become an issue. One lasting legacy for Manafort is the weakening of the language in the Republican Platform concerning assistance for Ukraine.

Russia's economy is in turmoil due to sanctions and depressed oil prices. Trump installs pro-Russian Flynn as National Security Adviser and Russian Order of Friendship winner Rex Tillerson as Secretary of State. Russia chooses to not retaliate against additional sanctions.

The list goes on and on...the Fox News love affair with Putin, the alt-rights belief in Putin...but is it in America's best interest to take down Trump? Or is better if Trump becomes the Republican's puppet?

Paul Ryan is insulting when he addresses a press conferance and when asked questions about this story, he dismisses it and other GOP agenda items by acting like no one is intellectually capable of deciphering the facts...its maddening to listen to Republicans try to explain and justify this lying administration... the only people intellectually not capable of understanding or deciphering the facts are the "trumpster," the rest of the Americans are quite informed on issues and policies, to dismiss them as "not" is a grave mistake and just plain insulting! The only people Ryan has to do 'baby talk" with is trump himself who doesn't understand anything about Constitutional Law and who basically has never followed the law, he was a con man before the election and he still is a con-man and being a con-man is the least of his impropieties. To explain anything about governing to this man is like trying to explain to a child who has a obvious learning-disability and cannot comprehend anything including what is fact and what is fiction. Paul Ryan needs to get in touch with his constituents and actually get it through his thick head that most of them are far more informed and far smarter than he will ever be. He's completely "out of touch" with the American people, their level of intelligence and how comprehensively they are informed! Its insulting!

If Trump is clueless about what his "associates" did/are doing then he is not fit to be president (among SO many other reasons). He hides behind the office and lets his cronies (Flynn for starters) take the fall, in the hopes that will end any further investigation. Sessions has committed "apparent perjury" (per Pelosi). I say lock him up! Conway has acted illegally in promoting Ivanka. The WH says it was a "mistake," an "accident." Since when is ignorance a justifiable defense under the law? Since Trump!

If this were the Obama admin GOP enablers (a generous description) would be screaming for impeachment and/or worse. Talk about Evil Doers (per Bush 43). DO YOUR JOB Congress!! Do not wallow in Trumpian muck-swamp and live the same terrible lies. Protect our precious democracy before it is destroyed by the evils of corruption, unchecked power and relentless greed - - before it is stolen forever. (tears)
Remember the Teflon, Don?! Well, short of proving absolute sedition and treason by himself or his circle, we are going to have the Teflon, President,for a while!

If the Trump campaign in fact colluded with Russia to tip the election in their favor, it is so much more of a threat to US democracy and the nation’s well-being than Watergate ever was. Because we are already seeing how Trump, who may well be compromised and vulnerable to blackmail, is kowtowing to Russia's. This is apparent with all the senior aides Trump has brought in – many who never had any contact with Trump before but mysteriously pop up, like Carter Page. Then you have Rex Tillerson, Roger Stone (ex-Watergate), Steve Bannon, Steve Miller, Michael Flynn. And now, billionaire Wilbur Ross, new Commerce Secretary, turns out to be director of a Cyprus bank that launders money for Russian oligarchs. More frightening still is Trump’s weak support for NATO and the European Union, two institutions that Putin so desperately wants to undermine because they are obstacles to Putin’s vision to reestablish a Soviet Empire. Clearly, Trump would have rescinded the sanctions if there were not the attention focused on it. Trump is a Putin-wannabe authoritarian – as demonstrated by his worldview (the US is as corrupt as Russia), his antipathy to a free press and independent judiciary, his view of an unrestrained, unquestioned Executive, and yes, his admiration for Putin and other dictators. And if he is allowed to continue, Trump will turn the US into a kleptocracy, just as Putin has.
